column4: When I boot the computer, I get "The application 'NetworkManager Applet' (/usr/bin/nm-applet) wants access to the default keyring, but it is locked", and I have to enter the keyring password to access the wireless network. How do I let it connect to the wireless network without asking for the keyring password?
system -> preference -> encryption and keyrings (check there)

I don't have "System -> Preferences -> encryption and keyrings", did you mean "Applicatins -> Accessories -> Passwords and Encryption Keys"? I looked there and didn't find an option to not ask for the keyring password
sorry, im still on 9.04, thats where i could have checked (had the problem and google worked a while ago)
